benchmark_details.name: MINT (Multi-modal Image and Narrative Text Dubbing Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The MINT dataset was constructed to enhance the foley audio dubbing tasks involving narrative texts and images, addressing the limitations of existing datasets related to text-to-audio technology.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust dataset for foley audio dubbing tasks incorporating multi-modal inputs such as image and narrative text.

data.source: Constructed using images from YouTube videos aligned with audio descriptions from AudioCaps, enhanced with narrative text generated by large language models.
data.size: 35,363 training samples, 2,532 validation samples, 2,121 test samples
data.annotation: Manually annotated and expanded using language models based on detailed instructions.

methodology.calculation: FD and KL divergence calculated based on generated audio samples compared to target samples.
methodology.interpretation: Higher FD indicates generated audio is closer to target audio; higher OVL and REL indicate better alignment with narrative text.
methodology.baseline_results: Existing models like AudioGen and Tandem structures were tested against the proposed methods, showing significant performance improvements.
methodology.validation: Tests were conducted with random samples and comprehensive evaluation metrics to ensure model reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset is for academic and research purposes only, adhering to fair use policies.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC-SA-4.0 license for MINT dataset; AudioCaps dataset is under MIT License.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Involved subjects were aligned with terms ensuring academic use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Dataset development aimed at following guidelines for copyright and privacy.
